TopicTitle: How to have two KSP saves, one modded and one stock

Articles.Content: Hello, today I am planning on recording my first youtube video ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif), which will be the start of a stock KSP career mode series. However, the KSP game I have has a bunch of mods installed, and I do not want to get rid of them. So how do I have two separate KSP saves, one which is modded and one which is not?

Just make a copy of your KSP folder and download it agan via Steam. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

It should be located under C:/program files (x86)/steam/steamapps/common/kerbal space program
Thanks! My first video should be up sometime today!

There was a mod for loading only the mod you wanted to for each save, but I tried it and only got a bug where it wouldn't load.

Good luck!

You could try [Addon Controller](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/94811-Addon-Controller-Toggle-addons-and-parts-on-off-for-individual-saves). It initially loads every mod in your GameData folder, but it can change the mods and parts for individual saves from the main menu.

just have them sitting in two different folders. after you download it from kerbalspaceprogram.com, just unpack it into different folders.

couldn't be easier.
